message.content:
cs.CR, cs.AI, cs.SE, cs.NI, cs.SY 

The paper deals with the problem of generating and executing possible hacking attacks to assess network security, which falls under the category of computer security (cs.CR). The paper also proposes a methodology that uses partially observable Markov decision processes (POMDP) to model the attack planning problem, which is a subfield of artificial intelligence (cs.AI). The paper also discusses the use of scanning methods to reduce uncertainty about the network configuration, which is a topic in software engineering (cs.SE). Additionally, the paper deals with network structure and targeted approximations, which are relevant to network infrastructure (cs.NI) and control systems (cs.SY).
